item.title: SQL
item.description: Declare a Variable in MySQL (ref) There are mainly three types of variables in MySQL: User-defined variables (prefixed with @): You can access any user-defined variable without declaring it or initializing it. If you refer to a variable that has not been initialized, it has a value of NULL and a type of string. SELECT @var_any_var_name You can initialize a variable using SET or SELECT statement: SET @start = 1, @finish = 10;
